summary: The Department of Veterans Affairs’ Graduate Medical Education program trains more than 45,000 medical and dental residents annually. It reimbursed affiliated medical schools and teaching hospitals about $765 million in 2019—covering residents’ salaries for their work at VA facilities. After detecting payment errors at one facility, VA added a new oversight process meant to complement an existing requirement that facilities audit reimbursements. But overlap between...
title: VA Health Care: Actions Needed to Improve Oversight of Graduate Medical Education Reimbursement
